title: The Time Warrior
dialogue_triumphs: I'll chop him up so fine not even a sparrow will fill its beak.
Yours is indeed a towering intelligence.
A longshanked rascal with a mighty nose!
She'll not get far before one of my guards grabs her taille!
goofs: Bloodaxe has lots of horse trouble in episode one.
Irongron's gun goes off before he fires it.
Irongron fails to notice that his 'robot' has a fleshy neck.
Nobody tells the serving wenches to leave the exploding castle.
'Wessex' after the Norman conquest is an anachronism.
Possible anachronistic potatoes, though not as clear as commonly thought.

continuity_notes.name: Linx
continuity_notes.description: Commander of the Fifth Army Space Fleet of the Sontaran Army Space Corps. Has three fingers and muscles designed for load-bearing rather than leverage.
continuity_notes.current_status: On a reconnaissance mission to Earth

continuity_notes.name: Sontarans
continuity_notes.description: Warlike clone race with high gravity homeworld. At war with Rutans for millennia.
continuity_notes.current_status: Engaged in war with Rutans, developing time travel technology

continuity_notes.name: Rutans
continuity_notes.description: Alien race at war with Sontarans for millennia.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, has encountered Sontarans before despite memory loss.
continuity_notes.current_status: Investigating time disturbances in medieval England

continuity_notes.name: Sarah Jane Smith
continuity_notes.description: New companion to the Doctor, aware of UNIT.
continuity_notes.current_status: Accompanying the Doctor on her first adventure

technobabble: Linx carries a weapon that can strike, burn, stun, control humans and make captives speak.
roots: A Connecticut Yankee at King Arthur's Court
Star Trek ('A Piece of the Action')
links: The Brigadier refers to Jo and Metebelis 3.

locations.name: Wessex
locations.description: Region in medieval England during the reign of King Richard I
locations.current_status: Setting for the majority of the story's events

locations.name: England
locations.description: Country on Earth in the present day
locations.current_status: Secondary setting for parts of the story

untold_adventures: The Doctor would like to study under Rembrandt
additional_notes: This story introduces the Sontarans and Sarah Jane Smith. It also features anachronistic use of the term 'Wessex' and potentially anachronistic potatoes.
bottom_line: The script is one of Robert Holmes' funniest. With David Daker and John J. Carney's OTT performances, and Elisabeth Sladen's instant presence, the result is a rather wonderful romp.
